result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Charles A. Towsley in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Michael Albrecht for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney ORourke addresses restitution of 14CF312 to $7110.99.  No request to reduce that amount.  1000.00 to R.R. no reduction requested for that amount.  Amount of $16799.23 is being requested for reduction to $6290.00.  Attorney ORourke calls defendant, Charles A. Towsley, sworn & testifies.  Currently on probation, serving conditional jail.  Employment history: current and previous.  Attorney ORourke marked exh 1.  Identified by defendant.  State cross examines defendant re: employment.  Attorney ORourke redirect.  Attorney ORourke argues ability to pay.  No argument on amount payable to individuals.  State argues.  Court grants request of Attorney ORourke.  Modified amount of $6290.00 due to Insurance Co. granted.  Restitution order to be drafted by Attorney ORourke.
Restitution hearing on March 31, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Restitution hearing on March 13, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Charles A. Towsley in court with attorney Debra V. O'Rourke.  Defendant Charles A. Towsley in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court dismisses but reads in based on plea in 14CF318.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 19, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial on January 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on December 29, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Charles A. Towsley in court with attorney Debra V. O'Rourke.  Defendant Charles A. Towsley in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial br. 3.  Bond continues.
Prelim. Hrg. waived, Rec'd copy of INFO/waived reading

Defendant Charles A. Towsley in court with attorney Debra V. O'Rourke.  Defendant Charles A. Towsley in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 3

Pre-trial conference on October 17, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Return date on October 28, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Charles A. Towsley by video from LEC with attorney Debra V. O'Rourke.  Defendant Charles A. Towsley in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty O'Rourke requests time limits for prelim be waived in both matters (14CF312 and 14CF318) and requests PTC and RD's be set as soon as possible.  Court accepts time limit waiver and sets matters for PTC and RD.  Bonds continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 17, 2014 at 11:00 am.  Return date scheduled for October 28, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 2, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 3, 2014 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Charles A. Towsley in court.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Waives right to an attorney for today's appearance.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits not waived. $1000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Booking today.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 3, 2014 at 11:15 am.
